task_summary: Robot visually locates the towel, confirms detection, and iteratively approaches and aligns to it for reaching.

task_long_description.overview: In this episode, a bimanual robotic manipulator is directed to reach a pink towel on a tabletop. The robot begins with visual search and confirmation for the towel, then progressively aligns and approaches to execute a reliable reach. No grasp or manipulation is required, focusing only on physically reaching and aligning with the towelâ€™s position, as seen in the frames.
preconditions: Towel is present and unobstructed on the workspace
Camera feed is available for object detection
stepwise_plan: Check if the towel is visible in the workspace
If not visible, scan area to locate towel (up to 3 attempts)
Approach and align to the towel with tight positional tolerance
success_criteria: Manipulator reaches near the towel with precise alignment
Towel is visually confirmed and physical approach concludes without contact errors
failure_and_recovery: If towel not detected, repeat scan attempts (max three)
If approach fails, repeat alignment or raise fault
task_long_description.termination: Sequence ends when the manipulator has successfully approached and aligned to the towel, or after failure/recovery limits are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the towel is in the robot's field of view.
Scans the area for the towel, up to three raster attempts.
Detects the towel, refining its position for approach.
Moves manipulator near the towel, aligning with fine tolerance.

failure_modes: Scan fails to locate towel within 3 attempts
Approach alignment fails due to workspace obstruction
recovery_strategy: Repeated scan attempts if towel not detected
Abort or report if approach fails after retries
assumptions: Instruction implies simple reach (not grasp); frames confirm approach without grasp or manipulation.
No explicit force/press required; 'reach' is interpreted as controlled positional approach.
If conflicts arose between task instruction and frames, frames were prioritized for BT design.

expected_success_criteria: Manipulator physically positioned with alignment close to towel edge (visible in frames)
Visual pose estimation is successful and verified by robot
